text: was a after Hōji and before Kōgen. This period started in March 1249 and ended in October 1256.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kenchō" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 508. The reigning emperor was .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du Japon, pp. 248-255; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 231-232. ==Events of the Kenchō era== * 1252 (Kenchō 2): Great Buddha of Kamakura was put in place at Kōtoku-in.Tsubata, Kate. "The Great Buddha at Kamakura," The Washington Times, May 25, 2008; retrieved 2012-4-30. * 1253 (Kenchō 5): Kenchō-ji founded.Joint Council for Japanese Renzai Obaku Zen, Kenchō-ji; retrieved 2012-4-26. ==Related pages == * Kamakura period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Kenchō 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 1249 1250 1251 1252 1253 1254 1255 1256 Preceded by: Hōji Era or nengō: Kenchō Succeeded by: Kōgen Category:Japanese eras Category:1249 Category:1250 Category:1251 Category:1252 Category:1253 Category:1254 Category:1255 Category:1256 Category:1240s in Japan Category:1250s in Japan
title: Kenchō
